intro: Ruellia eucoma, commonly known as the narrow-leaved ruellia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and spikes of blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks. It is often used in ornamental gardening due to its attractive foliage and vibrant blooms. Ruellia eucoma is also valued for its ability to thrive in a variety of soil types and its relatively low maintenance requirements.
